result.execSummary:
The defendant Jestin E Gay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **Amended 8/1/16 to lift the no-contact regarding Carl Nelson.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or go upon any premises whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with Carl Nelson or Paul Nelson or go upon their premises.
**Amended 8/1/16 to lift the no-contact regarding Carl Nelson.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall take all prescription medications in the manner and method as prescribed by his physician.   Defendant not to terminate any prescriptions without his physicians approval.
Credit 70 days, if probation is revoked.

timeConds.notes: 40 days stayed, to be utilized by Agent upon application to the Court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
**Amended 1/3/19 to reflect 204 days credit, see below.  
Court indicates: Department of Correction does not need to write me another letter as to what they believe the credit should be.  It is established by this Court to be 204 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Conditions:
1.  pay costs of the action + RHT surcharges.
2.  pay restitution of $2405.36 to Foremost Insurance Group and $587.53 to Carl Nelson or Paul Nelson - monies to be paid out in full to individuals before paying out insurance company.
3.  def. to participate in any assessments as directed by his Agent.
4.  def. to pay supervision fees.
5.  def. to participate in any counseling deemed appropriate & follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
6.  def. to not possess/consume any alcohol or go upon any premises whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
7.  def. to take all prescription medications in manner & method as prescribed by his physician - not to terminate any prescription w/o his physician's approval.
8.  def. to not possess any dangerous weapon.
9.  def. to have no contact (directly or indirectly) with Carl Nelson or Paul Nelson or go upon their premises.
10.  def. to serve 45 days in co jail - stay 40 days to be utilized by agent upon application to the court - serve 5 days to commence FW w/WR privileges.
70 days credit, if revoked.
